messages.messageBody:
Thank you,
I am printing this out so I can take it with me to the library. (Where
Chaelene is frequently wanting to go). If I can't find them there then I
will try Vegas next time we go in.

Sharon
----- Original Message -----
From: <ElissaJC@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, April 16, 2002 6:18 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] resources for new unschoolers was Re: Not
an unschooler =)


> This is going to be short because I am typing one hand.
> www.sandradodd.com/unschooling
> www.unschooling.com go to the message boards, click on topics at the
bottom
> of the page sit back and read what looks interesting!
> Have you read any books by John Holt? He is known as the "father of
> unschooling"
> The Unschooling Handbook by Mary Griffith can be found at your local
> bookstore, It explains unschooling very well.
> Try some of these resources and you may find some clarity!
> Have fun!
> ~Elissa Cleaveland
> "It is nothing short of a miracle that the modern methods of instruction
> have
> not yet entirely strangled the holy curiosity of inquiry." A. Einstein
>

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] resources for new unschoolers was Re: Not an unschooler =)
messages.msgSnippet: This is going to be short because I am typing one hand. www.sandradodd.com/unschooling www.unschooling.com  go to the message boards, click on topics at the
messages.messageBody:
This is going to be short because I am typing one hand.
www.sandradodd.com/unschooling
www.unschooling.com go to the message boards, click on topics at the bottom
of the page sit back and read what looks interesting!
Have you read any books by John Holt? He is known as the "father of
unschooling"
The Unschooling Handbook by Mary Griffith can be found at your local
bookstore, It explains unschooling very well.
Try some of these resources and you may find some clarity!
Have fun!
~Elissa Cleaveland
"It is nothing short of a miracle that the modern methods of instruction
have
not yet entirely strangled the holy curiosity of inquiry." A. Einstein
